page.title: 06ST.RAPHAEL'S NORTHAW.
page.content: The brothers of the Hospitaller Order of St. John own St. Raphael's,Barvin Park. They take care of mentally handicapped men and women under the charge of six monks and fifty other staff. St.Raphael's cares for these people and gives them work and shelter.At present there are one hundred and twenty men and just five women,although it is hoped more women will be admitted gradually.It was purchased in 1930 and the original house is now used for administration.A villa was built in 1955, then the Pavilion was added.Ambitious plans are now underway to develop a 'village' where the residents can live in normal houses and the institutionalised buildings will be converted.Farming, gardening and craftwork is all well organised there and the public may buy produce from the greenhouses there.
